description: '''Pop rap''' (also known as '''pop hip-hop''', '''pop hop''', '''hip pop''', '''melodic hip-hop''' or '''melodic rap''') is a [[genre of music]] fusing the [[Rapping|rhythm-based lyricism]] of [[hip-hop|hip hop]] with [[pop music|pop]]'s preference for [[Melody|melodic]] vocals, [[Catchiness|catchy]] [[Hook (music)|hooks]], and positive lyrics on pop-like productions and structure, as well as samples of various popular songs. This genre gained mainstream popularity during the [[1990s in music|1990s]], though the influences and roots of pop rap can trace back to late-1980s hip-hop artists such as [[Run-DMC]], [[LL Cool J]], and [[Beastie Boys]].
